data.text: As #G20 policymakers gather this week in Japan, the goal must be to help, not hinder global growth. How? By reducing #trade tensions and clearing other stumbling blocks on the way to a more durable and inclusive world economy. https://t.co/aVLe1UBnjm #IMFBlog https://t.co/tx9GA8EcKX

There are tentative signs of stabilization in the global economy with growth expected to increase from 3.3% this year to 3.6% in 2020. At this delicate moment, the policy mix-–monetary, fiscal, & financial policies-–must be carefully calibrated. #G20 note https://t.co/qiP98zRyAW https://t.co/Oelj8WiEtg

Christine @Lagarde will participate in a discussion with @AEI Senior Fellow Desmond Lachman at the American Enterprise Institute on the #G20 and the global economy, following introductory remarks by AEI president @arthurbrooks. 
Join us today, 3pm ET: https://t.co/ixPWJ1O0u0

In our latest issue of F&D, four young academics give their take on the most pressing issues facing the global economy in the decades to come. Learn more at https://t.co/NZt7lmJ2A5 https://t.co/taJqpn4goK

We have just released the preliminary findings of the IMF’s annual review of #China’s economy. China’s economic growth stabilized in early 2019 and is expected to moderate to 6.2% in 2019 and 6.0% in 2020. Read the full statement here https://t.co/82PP2aMrW2 https://t.co/liDJUHaxk2

IMF’s Commitment no. 2 to help countries achieve their Sustainable Development Goals or #SDGs: support them in dealing with climate change. For more IMF efforts read: https://t.co/uFpit8RdAS https://t.co/WGpEDO3NAX
